info.orestes.rest.conversion

Class ConverterService

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.orestes.rest.conversion.ConverterService

  • public class ConverterService
extends java.lang.Object

    This ConverterService is used by the ConversionHandler to transform request arguments and request entities between java types and representations as well as for response entities.

    To handle the conversion accurately the content will be processed in two steps.

    • For in bound messages: raw data -> interpretable java representation -> java object
    • For out bound messages: java object -> interpretable java representation -> raw data

    The conversion between raw data <-> interpretable java representation will be handled by a ConverterFormat implementation.
    The conversion between interpretable java representation <-> java object will be handled by a Converter implementation.

      • ConverterService

        public ConverterService(Module module,
                        boolean loadConverters)
        Constructs a new Converter service with a Module that is being used to instantiate loaded Converters
        Parameters:
        module - The module used to create loaded converters
        loadConverters - ste this argument to false to prevent auto loading of the Converters. They can be loaded with loadConverters() afterwards

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public static void check(Converter<?,?> converter,
                         java.lang.Class<?> type,
                         java.lang.Class<?>[] genericParams)
                  throws UnsupportedMediaType
        Checks if the Converter can handle a java object of the given type with the given generic arguments.
        Parameters:
        converter - The converter which will be checked
        type - The type to check for
        genericParams - the generic parameter types to check for
        Throws:
        UnsupportedMediaType - if the converter is null or not compatible with the given java type
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the genericParams count does not match the expected generics count declared by the java type

      • loadConverters

        public void loadConverters()
        Load all ConverterFormats form the "info.orestes.rest.conversion.format" package and add them to the {@link ConverterService

      • addFormat

        public void addFormat(ConverterFormat<?> format)
        Register a new format to the ConverterService. In addition it will load all Converters form the ConverterFormat.getConverterPackageName() package and register them to the ConverterService
        Parameters:
        format - The format which will be registered

      • addFormat

        public void addFormat(ConverterFormat<?> format,
                      boolean loadConverters)

      • getFormat

        public <F> ConverterFormat<F> getFormat(java.lang.Class<F> formatType)
        Get all available converters for a given format
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type
        Returns:
        All available converters that can handle the specified format
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • add

        public <F> void add(Converter<?,F> converter)
        Register a Converter to the ConverterService. If the Converter have a Accept annotation, it will be used to convert values between the declared Accept.value() media types and the Converters java type.
        Parameters:
        converter - The converter which will be registered

      • toObject

        public <T> T toObject(ReadableContext context,
                      MediaType source,
                      java.lang.Class<T> target)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      RestException
        Reads the given java type form the ReadableContext and return the decoded value
        Parameters:
        context - The ReadableContext to read from
        source - The media type of the encoded value
        target - The java type of the decoded value
        Returns:
        The read and decoded value
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if no converter is available to handle the conversion
        RestException - if an exception occurred while decoding the value
        java.io.IOException - if an unexpected exception occurred while reading or decoding the value

      • getAcceptableMediaTypes

        public java.util.Set<MediaType> getAcceptableMediaTypes(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Gets a set of all MediaTypes that can be handled for the given type. The returned set is empty if the type is not supported.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to handle
        Returns:
        All supported MediaTypes

      • getPreferedMediaType

        public MediaType getPreferedMediaType(java.util.List<MediaType> acceptedMediaTypes,
                                      java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Gets the best MediaType form the list of prioritized media types which is supported for the given type by this ConverterService instance
        Parameters:
        acceptedMediaTypes - The list of prioritized media types which are acceptable
        type - The type for which the media type is selected
        Returns:
        The best matched media type or null if none of the acceptable media types is supported

      • createServiceDocumentTypes

        public ConverterService.Types createServiceDocumentTypes()
        Returns a snapshot of all currently registered types which can be used in the service document for entities and method arguments
        Returns:
        An implementation of ServiceDocumentTypes that contains all available entity and argument types
